subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Tuesday, May 01, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Bush will make a statement after receiving Iraq
spending bill

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- President
Bush will make a statement Tuesday at 6:10 p.m., about two
hours after he receives a $124 billion war-spending bill that
calls for the withdrawal of American combat troops from Iraq,
the White House said. 

The president has said he will
veto the measure. 

Dan Bartlett, a counselor to the
president, said Bush has asked the three broadcast networks for
air time at 6:10 p.m.

***

Reid,
Pelosi send Iraq bill to President Bush

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Democratic congressional leaders
officially sent the Iraq spending measure to the White House
Tuesday, defying President Bush's repeated pledge to veto the
legislation.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/reid-pelosi-send-iraq-bill-to-president.html

***

On victory speech anniversary, Bush says
failure in Iraq 'unacceptable'

MACDILL AIR
FORCE BASE, Florida (CNN) -- Four years after declaring victory
in Iraq in a much-ballyhooed speech from the deck of an
aircraft carrier, President Bush said Tuesday a U.S. failure in
the 4-year-old war "should be unacceptable to the civilized
world."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/on-victory-speech-anniversary-bush-says.html

***

Obama to attend New Hampshire Democratic
debate

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Barack Obama,
D-Illinois, has accepted an invitation to participate in New
Hampshire's first Democratic presidential debate on June 3,
hosted by CNN, WMUR-TV, and the New Hampshire Union Leader, a
spokesperson for his campaign tells CNN.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-to-attend-new-hampshire.html

***

Clinton to attend Democratic debate in New
Hampshire

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Hillary
Clinton, D-New York, will attend New Hampshire's first 2008
Democratic presidential debate on June 3, an event that is
being sponsored by CNN, WMUR-TV, and the New Hampshire Union
Leader, her campaign announced Tuesday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-to-attend-democratic-debate-in.html

***

House panel approves subpoena for former
Deputy Attorney General

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
By a voice vote, a House Judiciary Subcommittee approved
Tuesday the issuing of a subpoena to former Deputy Attorney
General James Comey to testify as part of its investigation
into the firing of the eight U.S. Attorneys.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/house-panel-approves-subpoena-for.html

***

McCain pulling ahead of Giuliani, Edwards ahead in
Iowa

WASHINGTON (CNN)-- Sen. John McCain,
R-Arizona, is pulling ahead of former New York City mayor Rudy
Giuliani in a three key states according a new poll by American
Research Group.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mccain-pulling-ahead-of-giuliani_01.html

***

McConnell's office highlights Biden's blunt
talk on Bush's veto threat

WASHINGTON (CNN)
-- Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell's, R-Kentucky, office
is highlighting a YouTube video that shows Sen. Joe Biden,
D-Delaware, delivering some blunt words about what Democrats
will do if President Bush vetoes the Iraq spending bill.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mcconnells-office-highlights-bidens.html

***

Sen. Brownback...Girl Scout?

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Sam Brownback, R-Kansas, may blame
their cookies for some recent weight gain, but he's proud to be
an honorary Girl Scout.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/sen-brownbackgirl-scout.html

***

Democratic presidential hopefuls chide Bush on
"Mission Accomplished" speech

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- The leading contenders for the Democratic presidential
nomination chided President Bush Tuesday for his bold
declaration four years ago that the U.S. had successfully
completed its military operations in Iraq. Bush delivered the
now-famous speech aboard the U.S.S. Abraham Lincoln under a
banner that declared "Mission Accomplished."

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/democratic-presidential-hopefuls-chide.html

***

Female voters set high standards for female
candidates

NEW YORK (AP) -- For the first
time in history, a woman has the visibility, the reputation and
the cash to make a serious run at the presidency.

It
would seem that Sen. Hillary Clinton, the Democratic
front-runner, would be in a solid position to parlay the female
vote into success against an all-male field in 2008.

But women running for office face an unusual political
conundrum: Women sometimes set exceedingly high standards for
female candidates.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/01/electing.women.ap/index.html
